author: greysonmage
content: IMO.. Miners who sell their hardware last will likely get lower prices. Some miners will sell early to avoid that. So we should expect hashrates to drop somewhat, and TD of 5875 to be reached several days later than 9/15

author: dirigible6945
content: Currently the hashrate has surged enough that we might have to consider increasing the TTD to stay within the 10 day window.

author: dirigible6945
content: Will the devs be re-running the estimation for a Sept 15/16 day on Thursday*** <@552133098075193354> ?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes, I want to double check the number tomorrow before we merge it into geth

author: mrabino1
content: there are really two groups of miners here. some that are watching the market and those that just aren't. any short term surge comes from those mining because of price... and at the same time it causes the community to consider pushing it out, those same miners will also be the first to power down their equipment as the merge arrives ... and by powering down it significantly extends when the ttd will be hit.

author: mrabino1
content: even at the current merge ttd, any such surge has move the theoretical date up by 24 hours (not really more) ... that said if we see a significant pull back we will add a week .... it is disproportionate in the context that it is far easier to remove significant hash power than to add it

author: funnygiulio
content: What if >66% decide not to attest those blocks

author: funnygiulio
content: If not enough validator attest and consensus is not met and those txs will forever be excluded, i think it may have dangerous implications

author: funnygiulio
content: Could an OFAC split fork on the beacon chain be created? And if that happens would it win?

author: nishant0
content: The 66% will split into their own chain and will finalize a separate chain on it
